conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the ball and determine work done by these forces.
Identify forces: electric force, gravitational force, and normal force.
Electric force must be balanced by gravitational force for net vertical acceleration to be zero.
Resolve electric force into components: horizontal and vertical.
Vertical component of electric force equals gravitational force: qE sin(theta) = mg.
Work done by electric force is related to change in electric potential energy.
Initial electric potential energy at point O is qE d_0.
Change in height is d_0 sin(theta).
Work done by electric field force is qE d_0 sin(theta).
Using qE sin(theta) = mg, work done is mg d_0.
Change in electric potential energy is mg d_0.
Difference in electric potential energy at highest point compared to point O is mgd_0.
